instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1502: What is A1502? A1502 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2014, Late 2013, Early 2015 with EMC 2875, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3476, 820-3536, 820-4924..
definitions.820-00012: What is 820-00012? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: It stays on the logo on your screen and externally if it gives an image
threads.message: hi i have a macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> motherboard model <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00012</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a. It does a very strange thing, I tell you. when you turn on the computer, the apple appears and stays charging for a long time, but the curious thing is that if you connect an external monitor, you see the image of the desktop and the loaded one, but on the screen of the macbook it stays with the logo. I think it is something of the smc but I wanted to consult it first to see what you think

threads.title: It stays on the logo on your screen and externally if it gives an image
threads.message:
"motherboard model <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00012</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>"
I cannot locate this code.

Progress bar of logo image is stuck on internal LCD?
Do you get full working desktop on the external monitor?

threads.title: It stays on the logo on your screen and externally if it gives an image
It stays on the logo on your screen and externally if it gives an image
threads.message:

threads.title: It stays on the logo on your screen and externally if it gives an image
threads.message:
Poco probable que el LCD interno quede con la imagen congelada, pero es mejor descartar probando otra pantalla entera.
Una vez dentro del sistema, usando el monitor externo, "juega" un poco con las opciones de video interno/externo y mira si cambia algo en LCD interno.

threads.title: It stays on the logo on your screen and externally if it gives an image
threads.message: Ya probé con otra pantalla y con la configuración de pantalla en el sistema operativo y sigue igual. Que más podría revisar? Es posible que sea el smc ?

threads.title: It stays on the logo on your screen and externally if it gives an image
threads.message: Has configurado de tal manera que el monitor externo reproduzca misma imagen que el LCD interno?

threads.title: It stays on the logo on your screen and externally if it gives an image
threads.message: Entiendo que si pero me podrías indicar cómo lo tendría que hacer por si acaso no lo esté haciendo bien. Dime los pasos a seguir para hacerlo correctamente. Gracias

threads.title: It stays on the logo on your screen and externally if it gives an image
threads.message: La pantalla no es y de configuración tampoco. Que podría ser ? Smc ?

threads.title: It stays on the logo on your screen and externally if it gives an image
threads.message:
De modo normal, el escritorio aparece en monitor externo un poco antes de que termine de cargar la barra de progreso en LCD interno.

Mira si tienes disponible la opcion de mirroring in menu bar y pincha en "Mirror Built-In Display".
Si no, abre System Preferences -> Displays -> Arrangement y marca la opcion "Mirror Displays".


[URL unfurl="true"]https://drive.google.com/file/d/1pjSJ68OSnhogxImIjgveMDs35iCdiG9O/view?usp=sharing[/URL]

Parece que la salida LCD interna se queda congelada.
Prueba otra pantalla LCD (compatible), por si acaso...

threads.title: It stays on the logo on your screen and externally if it gives an image
threads.message:
Bueno, me habia olvidado decirte probar PRAM reset.
Menos mal que dukefawks me lo recordo...

Prueba haer el reset 2-3 veces.
Si no sirve, habra que probar clean ME region despues.

threads.title: It stays on the logo on your screen and externally if it gives an image
threads.message: Una duda como hago para hacer el clean ME región en este MacBook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>, tengo la Svod3 y no se podré hacerlo con esta máquina o lo puedo hacer de otra manera. He visto que ahí una máquina que es la cmizapper medusa que está muy bien y te lo hace automáticamente. Como lo podría hacer sin máquina

threads.title: It stays on the logo on your screen and externally if it gives an image
threads.message: Hay que sacar el chip de BIOS y regrabarlo con un programador USB...
